alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 5:29AM EST until December 24 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the beaches, Pamlico Sound, and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...Until 11 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Inundation of portions of Hwy 12 through Pea Island, the Tri- Villages, and on other low lying soundside roads are properties are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With temperatures well below freezing, any lingering high water may become slushy and icy, causing additional impacts this morning. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Coast Guard Hatteras NC MLLW Categories - Minor 2.5 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 4.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/10 AM 2.6 1.4 1.8 3 Minor 24/08 PM 1.8 0.6 1.2 3 None 25/10 AM 1.9 0.7 1.0 2 None 25/09 PM 1.8 0.6 1.2 2 None 26/10 AM 1.8 0.6 0.9 1 None 27/01 AM 1.6 0.4 1.2 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
